intro: Streptocarpus kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its tubular flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. It produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
